      private static Lookups GetLookups()
      {
         var lookup = new global::System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary<string, global::Thinktecture.Tests.OuterClass.TestEnum1>(2, global::System.StringComparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase);
         var list = new global::System.Collections.Generic.List<global::Thinktecture.Tests.OuterClass.TestEnum1>(2);

         void AddItem(global::Thinktecture.Tests.OuterClass.TestEnum1 item, string itemName)
         {
            if (item is null)
               throw new global::System.ArgumentNullException($"The item \"{itemName}\" of type \"TestEnum1\" must not be null.");

            if (item.Key is null)
               throw new global::System.ArgumentException($"The \"Key\" of the item \"{itemName}\" of type \"TestEnum1\" must not be null.");

            if (lookup.ContainsKey(item.Key))
               throw new global::System.ArgumentException($"The type \"TestEnum1\" has multiple items with the identifier \"{item.Key}\".");

            lookup.Add(item.Key, item);
            item._itemIndex.Set(list.Count);
            list.Add(item);
         }

         AddItem(@Item1, nameof(@Item1));
         AddItem(@Item2, nameof(@Item2));

#if NET8_0_OR_GREATER
         var frozenDictionary = global::System.Collections.Frozen.FrozenDictionary.ToFrozenDictionary(lookup, global::System.StringComparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase);
#if NET9_0_OR_GREATER
         return new Lookups(frozenDictionary, frozenDictionary.GetAlternateLookup<global::System.ReadOnlySpan<char>>(), list.AsReadOnly());
#else
         return new Lookups(frozenDictionary, list.AsReadOnly());
#endif
#else
         return new Lookups(lookup, list.AsReadOnly());
#endif
      }

         global::System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary<string, global::Thinktecture.Tests.OuterClass.TestEnum1> Lookup,
